pullRequest.body:
These theorems are used in [Project VD](https://github.com/kebekus/ProjectVD), which aims to formalize Value Distribution Theory for meromorphic functions on the complex plane.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [d5030c6400](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20869/commits/d5030c6400e32f95c9538dbbcb0b03ae94888eb1)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ order_mul`
`+ order_mul_of_order_eq_top`
`+ order_pow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Ouch! I made a mistake. Because of a mishap with git, this PR became part of [PR 21057](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21057), which got merged into master today. Your suggestions have been incorporated, and PR 21057 has seen a regular review. I apologize for the mess-up!
Seems reasonable, thanks!
Some style comments. Somebody else should look at it from a higher-level point of view.
Seems reasonable, thanks!
I think this should be a normal comment, and not in the final documentation: what do you think?
I am unsure and therefore followed your suggestion. My instinct would be to mark this as 'private', but I see elsewhere that this is perhaps not the Mathlib style.
I would expect the name more like `order_eq_top_of_order_eq_top_mul_analytic`...
Changed the name following your suggestion.
Full stop, please: this is a complete sentence
Done, here and elsewhere.
Here's a small trick: you can write this as `use g₁ * g₂, by exact h₁g₁.mul h₁g₂` (and save the next two lines).
I was not aware of that syntax. Implemented following your suggestion.

```suggestion
    (hg : AnalyticAt 𝕜 g z₀) (h'f : hf.order = ⊤) :
```

```suggestion
  use g₁ * g₂, h₁g₁.mul h₁g₂
```
(if this doesn't work, we should figure out what's going wrong)
The `by exact` is indeed not necessary. Thanks.
For new code, my personal preference is `induction` without prime

@Ruben-VandeVelde Thanks for your suggestion that I would like to implement. I am a beginner, however, and I am struggling to make the tactic `induction` work -- I learned from `Mathematics in Lean` that only ever uses `induction'`. Can you please help or point me to a reference? Thank you so much! -- Best, Stefan.
@Ruben-VandeVelde Disregard my previous mail. Meanwhile I found [this](https://seasawher.github.io/mathlib4-help/tactics/#induction) and switched to the `induction` tactic as you suggested.

This name doesn't entirely make sense to me. How about
```suggestion
lemma order_mul_eq_top_of_order_eq_top {f g : 𝕜 → 𝕜} (hf : AnalyticAt 𝕜 f z₀)
```
or even
```suggestion
lemma order_mul_of_order_eq_top {f g : 𝕜 → 𝕜} (hf : AnalyticAt 𝕜 f z₀)
```
The second one is much better (to me), thanks!

pullRequest.title: feat: establish additivity of AnalyticAt.order under multiplication/powers of analytic functions
